2.speaker: PANDA
2.japanese: あんなところにおいしそうな笹が落ちてる
2.english: There's some delicious looking bamboo grass just lying there.

3.speaker: PANDA
3.english: A little taste... It's delicious! Oh?

8.speaker: PANDA
8.japanese: この笹　どうするの？
8.english: What are you going to do with this bamboo grass?

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: 笹だらけのパーティーだよ
11.english: It's a party with bamboo grass everywhere!

12.speaker: SASAKO
12.japanese: 七夕飾りに使うんだよ
12.english: We're going to use it for Tanabata decorations. Tomorrow's Tanabata.

14.speaker: SASAKO
14.english: That would be a windfall {\i1}(tanabota){\i0}. That would be idle gossip {\i1}(idobata){\i0}.

15.speaker: SASAKO
15.english: That would be a field of flowers {\i1}(hanabatake){\i0}.

16.speaker: SASAKO
16.japanese: 七夕はね　夏のお祭りだよ

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: お祭り？　やっぱり　笹パーティー？
18.english: A festival? So it is a bamboo grass party?

21.speaker: PENGUIN
21.japanese: それで神様が怒ってしまい
21.english: ...And then the god was angry, so he pulled her and Hikoboshi apart, right?

22.speaker: PENGUIN
22.japanese: で　七夕っていうのは
22.english: So, Tanabata is for Orihime and Hikoboshi...

24.speaker: PENGUIN
24.japanese: なんで怖い人がいるの？
24.english: Why is there a scary person?

25.speaker: POLAR BEAR
25.japanese: つまりね　彦星と織姫と鬼姫の３人が揃うと
25.english: So when Hikoboshi, Orihime and Onihime are united,

26.speaker: POLAR BEAR
26.japanese: 夏の夜空に大三角が完成
26.english: they form the Summer Triangle in the night sky.

27.speaker: PENGUIN
27.english: That's not it. So it's a love triangle?

29.speaker: PENGUIN
29.japanese: でね　その彦星と織姫の２人が…

31.speaker: PENGUIN
31.japanese: ちょっと…　聞いてる？

32.speaker: PANDA
32.japanese: 聞いてるよ　鬼の三角関係
32.english: I'm listening to the story of the oni's love triangle.

34.speaker: PENGUIN
34.japanese: 七夕のこと教えてって言ったのパンダくんでしょう？
34.english: You're the one who asked me to explain Tanabata to you.

35.speaker: PANDA
35.japanese: それで　笹はいつ食べるの？
35.english: So when do you eat the bamboo grass?

36.speaker: PENGUIN
36.japanese: だから　食べないって
36.english: I'm trying to tell you that you don't eat it.

37.speaker: PENGUIN
37.japanese: 紙なんかで作った飾りをいっぱいつけて
37.english: You hang lots of paper decorations on it,

38.speaker: PENGUIN
38.japanese: それから　願いごとを書いた短冊なんかもぶら下げるんだよ
38.english: and then you hang strips of paper with wishes written on them.

39.speaker: PANDA
39.japanese: そんなに　いろいろつけたら食べるとき邪魔だよ
39.english: But if you put all that stuff on there, it'll be in the way when you're eating.

40.speaker: PENGUIN
40.japanese: 聞いてないな あの笹は食べないんだって
40.english: You're not listening at all. I'm saying that you don't eat that bamboo grass. You need to tell me that first.

42.speaker: POLAR BEAR
42.japanese: 笹を食べずに 短冊をぶら下げたら
42.english: If you hang up your wish and don't eat the bamboo grass,

45.speaker: POLAR BEAR
45.english: If it's a small one. What? No big wishes?

46.speaker: POLAR BEAR
46.japanese: 中くらいなら大丈夫じゃない？
46.english: Maybe a medium-sized one. What are you talking about?

48.speaker: PANDA
48.japanese: それが願いごとを書く紙？
48.english: Is that the paper you write your wish on?

49.speaker: SASAKO
49.japanese: ああ… これは飾りを作ってるんだよ

51.speaker: SASAKO
51.english: Do you want to try too, Panda?

52.speaker: PANDA
52.japanese: うん！　やる　やる！

55.speaker: SASAKO
55.japanese: 半田さん　動物園は今日はお休みなんですか？
55.english: Are you off from the zoo today, Mr. Handa?

56.speaker: HANDA
56.english: Huh? Y-Yes. You've been coming by a lot recently.

57.speaker: HANDA
57.english: Uh, no... I mean, uh, yes.

59.speaker: HANDA
59.japanese: あっ　あぁ　いや

60.speaker: HANDA
60.japanese: こ…　心が落ち着くというか
60.english: It calms my heart or something...

62.speaker: SASAKO
62.japanese: あっ　じゃあ お邪魔しちゃ悪いですね
62.english: Oh! Then I should probably leave you alone.

64.speaker: PANDA
64.japanese: ねぇ　笹子さん　これ　どうやるの？
64.english: Hey, Miss Sasako, how do you do this?

66.speaker: PENGUIN
66.japanese: どうしたらこうなるか不思議だよ
66.english: I can't even tell how you made that.

67.speaker: POLAR BEAR
67.japanese: ある意味　器用だね
67.english: In a way, he's really talented.

68.speaker: SASAKO
68.japanese: もう そんなこと言っちゃダメですよ
68.english: Oh, don't say things like that.

69.speaker: SASAKO
69.english: Listen carefully. First, you fold it from this end, like this... Like this?

71.speaker: POLAR BEAR
71.english: And then you fold that three times...

76.speaker: POLAR BEAR
76.english: Well, at least it's black and white. Here you go, Miss Sasako.

77.speaker: SASAKO
77.japanese: じゃあ　飾りは ひとまず置いといて
77.english: We'll leave the decorations for later,

78.speaker: SASAKO
78.japanese: 次は　短冊を作るね
78.english: and work on the strips of paper next.

79.speaker: PANDA
79.english: The ones you write your wish on?

81.speaker: SASAKO
81.japanese: これに願いごとを書いてね
81.english: Go ahead and write your wish on here.

82.speaker: SASAKO
82.japanese: 明日の夕方までに 持ってきてくれたら
82.english: If you bring it back by tomorrow night,

83.speaker: SASAKO
83.english: I'll hang it on the bamboo grass.

84.speaker: PANDA
84.japanese: これに中くらいまでの願いごとを書くの？
84.english: So I write up to a medium-sized wish on here?

85.speaker: SASAKO
85.japanese: なんでも大丈夫だと思うよ
85.english: I think you can write whatever you want.

86.speaker: PANDA
86.japanese: えっ？　なんでもいいの？

88.speaker: PANDA
88.english: I wonder what I should wish for!

89.speaker: SASAKO
89.japanese: はい　ペンギンさんも　どうぞ
89.english: Here's one for you, too, Mr. Penguin.

91.speaker: POLAR BEAR
91.japanese: なんでもいいんでしょ？
91.english: You can write whatever you want, right?

92.speaker: PENGUIN
92.japanese: ペン子さんへの気持は なんでもよくないよ
92.english: I can't write whatever about my feelings toward Miss Penko!

93.speaker: PENGUIN
93.english: I don't think one strip is going to be enough.

94.speaker: PENGUIN
94.japanese: 笹子さん　１０枚ちょうだい
94.english: Could you give me ten, Miss Sasako? Huh?

97.speaker: SASAKO
97.english: It's just one per person. Here you go.

99.speaker: SASAKO
99.english: Here's one for you, Mr. Handa.

100.speaker: SASAKO
100.english: A strip of paper to write your wish on, for Tanabata.

101.speaker: HANDA
101.japanese: ありがとうございます

102.speaker: SASAKO
102.japanese: 明日は七夕デーで夜遅くまでやってますからね
102.english: We'll be open late tomorrow because of Tanabata.

105.speaker: PANDA
105.english: I wonder what I should wish for.

106.speaker: PANDA
106.japanese: 笹がいっぱい食べられますようにって
106.english: Maybe I should wish that I can eat a lot of bamboo grass.

107.speaker: PENGUIN
107.japanese: パンダくんいつもいっぱい食べてるじゃない
107.english: You already always eat a lot of it, Panda.

108.speaker: PANDA
108.japanese: ペンギンさんは　何書いたの？
108.english: What did you write, Mr. Penguin?

110.speaker: PENGUIN
110.japanese: １枚しかないから迷っちゃうね
110.english: You only get one, so it's hard, you know?

111.speaker: PANDA
111.japanese: みんな何書いてるんだろう？
111.english: I wonder what everyone else is writing?

113.speaker: HANDA
113.japanese: いや　そもそもその前に彼女だよな
113.english: No, before that, I need a girlfriend.

115.speaker: SASAKO
115.japanese: は～い！ちょっと　お待ちくださ～い！
115.english: Yes, one moment please! Miss Sasako is so cute. I-I'm sorry. Um, it's nothing...

116.speaker: HANDA
116.japanese: パンダくん　聞いた？
116.english: Did you hear what I just said, Panda?

118.speaker: HANDA
118.japanese: いや　別に それだけが目的じゃ…
118.english: Er, that's not the only reason why I come here, though! The coffee is really good, too.

119.speaker: PANDA
119.japanese: 半田さん 動物園で会えるのに
119.english: You can see me all you want at the zoo, Mr. Handa.

120.speaker: PANDA
120.japanese: かわいい僕を見に カフェに来るなんて
120.english: Yet you come here just to see cute, little me.

122.speaker: PANDA
122.japanese: かわいいからね　僕
122.english: I am totally cute. No, I'm saying that Miss Sasako is cute. Miss Sasako.

126.speaker: HANDA
126.japanese: まだ　そんな 関係じゃないから！
126.english: I don't know her that well yet!

131.speaker: PANDA
131.japanese: 動物の世話好きな男性とかどう思う？
131.english: what do you think of guyswho like to take care of animals? And how about a guy built sort of like a panda?

133.speaker: PENGUIN
133.japanese: 何やってんの？　あれ

135.speaker: FT PANDA
135.japanese: ほほう…　半田さんがね
135.english: Oh, Mr. Handa said that? Yeah. I wonder why he doesn't just say it.

136.speaker: FT PANDA
136.japanese: 半田さんは　奥手だしね
136.english: Well, Mr. Handa is a late bloomer.

138.speaker: FT PANDA
138.japanese: 雑誌なんかで知識は豊富そうだけど
138.english: He's full of knowledge from magazines and such,

139.speaker: FT PANDA
139.japanese: いざとなるとてんで勇気が出ないタイプだね
139.english: but when it comes to the real thing, he chickens out.

140.speaker: PANDA
140.english: I totally know what you're talking about.

141.speaker: PANDA
141.japanese: えっと…　たしか耳年寄り？

142.speaker: FT PANDA
142.japanese: ツッコみづらい間違え方しないでよ
142.english: Would you stop making mistakes that are hard to retort?

143.speaker: PANDA
143.japanese: 半田さんにアドバイスしたいんだけど 何かない？
143.english: I want to give Mr. Handa some advice. Any ideas? What? You're asking me?

144.speaker: PANDA
144.japanese: だって　常勤パンダさん経験豊富でしょ？
144.english: Well, you're full of experience, Mr. Full-time Panda.

146.speaker: FT PANDA
146.japanese: 勝手に　バツ２にしないでって 言ったでしょ
146.english: I've asked you not to go around saying I've been divorced twice.

147.speaker: PANDA
147.english: But you know, we have a discerning eye regarding couples.

148.speaker: FT PANDA
148.japanese: あぁ　それは確かにね

149.speaker: PANDA
149.japanese: ここに来るお客さんは カップル多いもんね
149.english: A lot of the visitors who come here happen to be couples. Yeah.

150.speaker: FT PANDA
150.japanese: 初デートのカップルなんてういういしいよね
150.english: The couples out on their first date are so innocent.

151.speaker: FT PANDA
151.japanese: 手を繋ぐことも できなかったりしてさ
151.english: Sometimes they can't even hold hands.

153.speaker: FT PANDA
153.japanese: あとはケンカしてるカップルとかもいるよね
153.english: Then there are those couples that are fighting.

154.speaker: FT PANDA
154.japanese: こっちから見てても わかるっていうか

156.speaker: FT PANDA
156.japanese: ほら！こっちに来る あの２人は
156.english: Like those two heading over here.

157.speaker: FT PANDA
157.japanese: 今ちょっと気まずい感じだね
157.english: There's some uneasiness surrounding them right now.

160.speaker: FT PANDA
160.japanese: そこで　僕らを見つけると…

166.speaker: GIRL
166.japanese: ねね　次はどこ行こっか
166.english: So where should we go next?

168.speaker: PANDA
168.japanese: 常勤パンダさん　すご～い

170.speaker: PANDA
170.japanese: さすがは　ラテン系だね

171.speaker: FT PANDA
171.japanese: また　そんなキャラ付けする…
171.english: You're giving me weird characteristics again.

172.speaker: PANDA
172.japanese: アドバイス　お願いします！
172.english: Please give me advice, Mr. Full-time Manual Labor Panda!

173.speaker: FT PANDA
173.japanese: だから　ツッコミづらいって…
173.english: You're making it hard to retort again.

174.speaker: FT PANDA
174.japanese: まぁ　アドバイスとしては
174.english: Well, I guess one piece of advice is...

175.speaker: FT PANDA
175.japanese: 一歩前へ出るのが大事だね
175.english: it's important to take that step forward.

177.speaker: PANDA
177.japanese: 全然　恋の予感がしないよ？
177.english: I don't see love brewing there.

178.speaker: FT PANDA
178.japanese: 相撲して どうするの

181.speaker: FT PANDA
181.japanese: なんにしても 恋は積極性が大事だね
181.english: The important thing about love is assertiveness {\i1}(sekkyokusei){\i0}. Oh, so they have to be preachy {\i1}(sekkyo kusei){\i0}? Really?

182.speaker: FT PANDA
182.japanese: 今また　変な想像したよね？
182.english: You just imagined something really weird again, didn't you?

184.speaker: KIRINO
184.english: Thanks for all your hard work!

188.speaker: PANDA
188.japanese: 恋愛経験豊富な常勤パンダさんが
188.english: Mr. Full-time Panda, who is full of experience regarding love, gave me some advice for you.

191.speaker: HANDA
191.english: H-Huh? Not really... Well, nevermind, then.

192.speaker: HANDA
192.japanese: えっ！　せ…　せっかくだから 一応聞くよ
192.english: Huh? W-Well, I'll hear it just in case...

194.speaker: HANDA
194.japanese: でも　こんなものを飾って

195.speaker: HANDA
195.japanese: 笹子さんに見られたら 恥ずかしいな…
195.english: if I hung this up and Miss Sasako saw it.

196.speaker: PANDA
196.japanese: もう…　何悩んでるの？

197.speaker: PANDA
197.japanese: ほら！　恋は積極性が大事！
197.english: Come on! What's important in love is assertiveness!

202.speaker: SASAKO
202.japanese: パンダくん　半田さん

207.speaker: SASAKO
207.japanese: ちょうど 飾りつけが終わるところだよ
207.english: We were just getting done putting up the decorations. This is the last one.

209.speaker: POLAR BEAR
209.english: Well then, let's put it at the very top.

210.speaker: SASAKO
210.japanese: 今度は願いごとの短冊を つるしますよ～
210.english: Next, we'll be putting up all of the wishes!

217.speaker: PENGUIN
217.japanese: ペンこさんから告白されますように
217.english: May Miss Penko confess her love to me.

219.speaker: PENGUIN
219.japanese: どうしよう　告白されちゃったら！
219.english: Oh, what should I do if she asks me out?!

220.speaker: PENGUIN
220.japanese: 困っちゃうよ　困っちゃうよ 困っちゃうよ…
220.english: I don't know what to do! I don't know what to do! I don't know what to do!

222.speaker: SASAKO
222.japanese: 半田さん お願い書いてきました？
222.english: Did you write your wish, Mr. Handa?

225.speaker: PANDA
225.japanese: 恋は　積極性が大事
225.english: What's important in love is assertiveness!

227.speaker: SASAKO
227.japanese: じゃあ　つるしてください

229.speaker: SASAKO
229.japanese: 半田さん　彼女いないんですか？
229.english: You don't have a girlfriend, Mr. Handa?

232.speaker: SASAKO
232.japanese: 早くできるといいですね
232.english: I hope you find one soon!

235.speaker: PENGUIN
235.japanese: パンダくん　願いごとつるした？
235.english: Did you put your wish up, Panda? Oh!

236.speaker: PENGUIN
236.english: Jeez, did you forget? What should I write?

237.speaker: PANDA
237.japanese: えっと　足が長くなりますように
237.english: Let's see... May my legs get long.

239.speaker: PANDA
239.english: I want to be on TV.

244.speaker: SASAKO
244.english: It's nice and cool out. Thank goodness this Tanabata was sunny.

246.speaker: PANDA
246.japanese: ペンギン君　ペンギン君

248.speaker: PENGUIN
248.japanese: 今日は距離詰めてきたね　何？
248.english: You're bridging the gap today, what?

249.speaker: PANDA
249.japanese: 思い出せないくらい恥ずかしい
249.english: Tell me an embarrassing story you want to forget and would never say in public.

250.speaker: PENGUIN
250.japanese: それは人前で言わなくてもいいかな
250.english: How about I don't say it in public? Then could you just tell me?

251.speaker: PENGUIN
251.english: Not a chance. Then how about something that— Let's finish, Polar Bear.

252.speaker: POLAR BEAR
252.japanese: 次回のしろくまカフェは

253.speaker: POLAR BEAR
253.english: will be presented in still images—
